Jobtitle: HR Generalist
column8: Summary The Human Resources Generalist is responsible for ensuring the day-to-day operation of assigned HR functions within the respective line of business/function/country. The accountability spans from implementing HR operational strategies, analyzing people information and leading HR processes to proactively engaging in employee relations, executing employee development activities, and managing & implementing policies and procedures in support of the company culture. This role is primarily responsible for: Demonstrate employee advocacy and develops a reputation as a neutral and approachable HR professional serving all employees. Perform all HR related transactional country specific tasks (e.g., leave & exit management, visa and work permit, system related HR inputs for reporting). Be the first point of contact on all employee complaints, grievance and disciplinary matters. Communicates benefits-related changes and assists employees with questions regarding compensation. Support smooth execution of local engagement programs along with the COE. Provide on-site support for location specific HR activities (e.g., local onboarding). Perform local HR admin activities for legally required tasks (employee details, comp information). Actively participate and provide information for audits, risk, compliance. Ad hoc tasks, as required. What makes you a successful candidate? Demonstrated experience in HR role at least 3 years or above. Manage, schedule, and prioritize work, handle time properly, meet deadlines and ensure that this is being followed within the department. Bachelor’s degree in any field. Fluent in both Thai and English communication both written and verbal. Friendly, confident, and good interpersonal skill with the ability to communicate to all stakeholder’s level. Stay up to date on labor laws and related HR trend.

column8: Overall operational management Maintain HR workflow, its procedures, information system and technology of HR operations to improve  efficiency & effectiveness and provide satisfied employees’ experiences. Provide the annual budget estimation in part of recruitment, compensation & benefit, employee relation, and manage all expenses to be in line with an approved budget. Oversee administration of headcount management, recruitment, employee relationship, and all compensation  & benefit activities to comply with standard procedures Lead and develop team capability, knowledge, and skills to ensure career progression and engagement. Recruitment Manage headcount budget of each function, identify staff vacancies. Recruit, interview and  select talent applicants; co-manage on-boarding process (including new employee orientation). Enhance quality of recruitment platform, job portals, all recruitment channels (both online & offline) Manage the end of probation process for all new joiners, coaching managers through the process as needed. Compensation & Benefit Manage, oversee the monthly payroll, including all related actions according to local law requirements (e.g.  Revenue Department, Social Security, Provident Fund, Loan), and administrative processes by the responsible  HR Officers. Ensure accurate and timely reporting of payroll to Finance. Responsible for developing regular HR reports to  provide management with key data including headcount, staff turnover, Com & Ben expenses, and other  related topics. Managing and overseeing the benefits administration, organizing the annual review of the employee benefits to optimize cost while maximize benefits for all staff, benchmarking to the market as needed. Employee Relation Communicate policies pertaining to Human Resources, compensation, and benefits. Administers complex processes related to the delivery of HR services, collaborates with managers, and legal  advisor – conducting investigations, corrective actions, conflict resolution. Offer counseling services to employees, ensure engagement is maintained, and managers act in a way that  involves their staff.

Jobtitle: Boutique Office Executive (Boutique Base) - Cartier
column8: Want to grow your career with an amazing team?  Join us NOW as Boutique Office Executive for Thailand. HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT? The purpose of this position is to be responsible for the application of all back office tasks which are stock management procedures and ensures the daily management of boutique operations, CRM, IT and finance & banking operation. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES STOCK MANAGEMENT Manage all stock transfers (reception, departure, boutique to boutique, boutique to office/warehouse etc.) Controls the quality of all stock and validate the stock deliveries from warehouse Label products when receiving stock deliveries or transfers Manage client reservations Manage consigned products (press shooting, events, to staff, presentation outside) Manage boutique pick-ups and exchanges (product labels, stock movements…) Ensures daily protection and correct manipulation of pieces e.g. wrap watch with film before display Ensure replenishment of pieces on the sales floor Regularly check stock pieces quality and preparation to have them repaired (send to Customer Service platform if necessary) Organise price labelling and changes Support team to manage the annual, cycle and spot stock count (preparation, document, and contact with finance) Consolidate email enquiries on stock before distributing to each boutique member Monitor POSM stock utilization and stock level CRM ADMINISTRATION Manage CRM gift stock (keep record, contact with CRM team in the office) Help boutique manager to keep and maintain Client Database PROVIDE BASIC IT SUPPORT Report IT issues Follow up on solving IT issues FINANCE AND BANKING OPERATIONS SUPPORT Petty cash control Exchange information with Finance back-office Submit cash payment reports to Management Control Monitoring red-light report and inform boutique staff and finance team DAILY BOUTIQUE OPERATIONS Handle boutique supplies such as stationary, beverage and snacks stock for clients HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US? Organisation skills Detail and meticulous Team player Flexible and adaptable HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING? A great opportunity to be an essential contributor in a dynamic team, working for the success of a first class Luxury Maison under strong business acceleration and transformation Potential opportunities within the Richemont Group to help you develop and take your career to the next level YOUR JOURNEY WITH US: After being shortlisted, you will meet with HR Manager and Boutique Managers to get to know YOU and assess your fit to the role and share on the Maison culture and team dynamics Finally, you will meet with the Commercial Director to find out more about how we operate and an opportunity for you to ask questions about the business and the Maison. PERSONAL DATA COLLECTION STATEMENT We, Richemont Luxury (Thailand) Limited (“Richemont”), will collect and process your résumé, curriculum vitae or other personal information such as name, email address, postal address, telephone number and other information regarding yourself, your past employment and/or your education (hereinafter referred to as “Personal Data”) for the purposes related to the evaluation of your application and recruitment process as well as to contact and correspond with you to respond to such applications (“Purposes”). Failure to provide such Personal Data may affect our processing and evaluation of your application. All information provided by you will be used for the Purposes only. If your application is unsuccessful, we will keep your Personal Data for a period of 1 year and will destroy it after such period. Your Personal Data may be provided to our Group and any subsidiary company of our Group, and/or any internal/external trusted service providers in Thailand and outside of Thailand authorized to process the information for the Purposes. If you provide the personal data of any third partis to Richemont (including, for example, your previous employer), you agree that you have obtained their authorisation for Richemont to use the information for the Purposes.
